result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Robert C Dekan was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With credit for any administrative suspension.

Ignition Interlock Device shall be installed prior to operating a motor vehicle.  The length of Ignition Interlock Device will begin when a valid driver's license or occupational license has been issued.  (Call Dept of Motor Vehicles with questions).

miscConds.notes:
$2,277 fine - $225 credit = $2,052 fine due.    
$50 represents Ignition Interlock Device surcharge.
$2,052 to be paid at the Clerk of Courts Office.

$250 represents DNA surcharge.
$35 represents Blood Draw Test fee.
A total of $285 to be paid at the Clerk of Courts Office.
Any assessment and counseling as required and follow through and complete all required treatment.

Not to possess or consume any alcohol.  
Not to drive with any alcohol in system. 
 Not to possess or consume any illegal drugs.  
Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  
Not to go on any premises where primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.  
Not to drive w/o a valid driver's license.
